Description: Fragment (strongly curved) from the shoulder of a small North Ionian black-figured pottery dinos or krater; small part of neck (painted red) preserved; interior glazed red; exterior: part of a satyr running right, with row of solid tongues above; incision used for details of satyr. Brown-orange clay with fair number of medium sized inclusions, esp. lime, fair amount of small silver mica. .
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1138)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
